_header: He is wise that is wood
_description: On the Evils of the Time — three couplets

BLCottRollsII23.First Lines:
He is wise that is wodeHe is riche þat hase no
                    goode…
BLCottRollsII23.Last Lines:
…And
                    yaf hym with here þe Revere [?] way þat comeffro
                    Burdaux that is to wete vjxx town
BLCottRollsII23.Editions:
Madden,  Frederick. 
             “Political Poems of the Reigns of Henry VI and Edwrd IV.” 
             Archaeologia
         29 (1842): 318-47: 325.
Wright,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Political Poems and Songs relating to English History, composed during
                the period From the Accession of Edward III to that of Richard III.
             2 vols. 
             Rolls Series
         14 (1859, 1861); repr. Kraus, 1965: 2.225.

Bod100.Transcription:
He is wys þat is woedHe is riche þat naþ no
                    goodHe is blynd þat can y seeWel is hym þat nere may
                    þee
Bod100.Note:
Four lines. Preceded by the following: ‘þys prouerbe is
                    soþ in euery syde ho so goostly vnderstondeþ’.
